byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and VIVIAN YEE

abstract: New York State lawmakers, in second-to last legislative session before break, pass law allowing restaurants and bars to begin serving drinks on Sundays at 10 am; legislation, while welcomed by brunch set, all but dooms changes of passing meaningful ethics reforms.
lead_paragraph: A deal in Albany allows for earlier Sunday sales of alcoholic beverages, but ethics watchdogs and housing advocates are frustrated about the fate of their issues as the legislative session winds down.

headline.main: New York Legislators Back Alcohol at Brunch. But Ethics Reform? Hopes Are Fading.
headline.print_headline: Late Legislative Deals on Alcohol and Heroin; Hopes Fade for Ethics Reforms

snippet: A deal in Albany allows for earlier Sunday sales of alcoholic beverages, but ethics watchdogs and housing advocates are frustrated about the fate of their issues as the legislative session winds down.
